medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced right upper quadrant pain that started 36 hours prior to presentation, initially described as 'gas pain' which began 2 days ago and subsided by 6 PM but returned at 2 AM the following day, becoming persistent and associated with nausea and vomiting. The pain intensified with walking, and the patient had normal bowel movements 2 days prior with no diarrhea or blood.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Anemia due to beta thalassemia trait, MDS with thrombocytosis, treated H. pylori, type 2 diabetes, asthma, hypertension, osteoporosis, lumbar spinal stenosis, hypercholesterolemia. Past surgical history includes appendectomy and multiple trigger finger releases, as well as a fibroidectomy.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has a family history of thalassemia; her mother, who had thalassemia, passed away but further details about her age or cause of death are not specified.
